newsitem.title: FINLAND: MERITA SEES LITTLE INTEREST 2001 BOND AUCTION.
newsitem.headline: MERITA SEES LITTLE INTEREST 2001 BOND AUCTION.

text.p: Merita Bank said it does not recommend participating in the auction of the Finnish serial 2001 bond as it has been yielding below the German five-year bond for some weeks making it unattractive.

"Furthermore, the RoF (Republic of Finland) 2001 bond's unfavourable pricing on the yield curve, in comparison with other bonds, favours longer maturities," Merita said in a pre-auction comment dated March 6.
It said the markets were jittery ahead of the U.S. February payrolls figures due on Friday as the data will either set a bullish or bearish trend for the bond markets.
"Therefore it would be tossing a coin to be either an aggressive bidder or seller before the indicators," Merita said.
At 1215/1015 GMT, the 2001 bond yield was quoted at 4.66 percent.
The auction results are due after 1330/1130 GMT. In the previous auction on January 30, the treasury raised 1.01 billion markka at a yield of 4.73 percent.
